page.title: 18GOLD COINS AT WANBOROUGH
page.content:
Early in 1985 some{gold and silver {coins}were discovered in a field at Wanborough. They were identified as Roman, and declared by the courts to be Treasure Trove.
Lord Taylor,the owner of the land, has hired a guard to protect his fields from looters and treasure hunters who have been discovered digging by moonlight. Nearly a dozen looters have been arrested and the police are investigating the incidents.
{Archaelogists }say that the field could be the site of a{Roman Temple. Lord Taylor does not want to see his crop of wheat destroyed by the treasure hunters and their metal detectors.
